critique: The document expresses concern and determination in addressing the drug trafficking issue. It highlights the severity of the problem and declares a national emergency. There is a sense of urgency and resolve to combat this threat. It does not express joy. It expresses sadness because of the deaths of tens of thousands of Americans annually, as well as countless more non-fatal overdoses with their own tragic human toll. It expresses anger towards Drug cartels, transnational criminal organizations, and their facilitators. It expresses fear because international drug trafficking constitutes an unusual and extraordinary threat to the national security, foreign policy, and economy of the United States. It expresses disgust towards the illicit production, global sale, and widespread distribution of illegal drugs; the rise of extremely potent drugs such as fentanyl and other synthetic opioids; as well as the growing role of Internet-based drug sales. It expresses surprise because of the rise of extremely potent drugs such as fentanyl and other synthetic opioids; as well as the growing role of Internet-based drug sales.
